0.summary: Aleksei A. Navalny, Russia’s most resonant opposition voice and a Moscow mayoral candidate, was sentenced to five years in prison on embezzlement charges.
0.title: Putin Critic Gets 5-Year Jail Term, Setting Off Protests

1.summary: President Obama may cancel a meeting with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, where Edward J. Snowden has sought shelter.
1.title: Moscow Trip for Obama May Be Off as Snowden Tensions Build

2.summary: Researchers have found a genetic mutation that may help explain why some people can eat the same amount as others but gain more weight.
2.title: Overweight? Maybe You Really Can Blame Your Metabolism

3.summary: The online network Netflix officially joined its cable and broadcast counterparts on Thursday, picking up a best drama nomination for the political thriller “House of Cards.”
3.title: ArtsBeat: Netflix Does Well in 2013 Primetime Emmy Nominations

4.summary: President Obama said that more than 8.5 million people would be getting rebates this summer from their insurance providers.
4.title: Speaking Out for Health Care Act, Obama Says Millions Will Get Rebates

5.summary: The Federal Aviation Administration said it would review recommendations by British authorities to disconnect the batteries in the emergency locator transmitters on all Boeing 787s.
5.title: British Investigators Point to Transmitter Battery in 787 Fire

6.summary: The vessel was impounded on Sunday after the crew, armed with what officials called sticks, tried to fend off Panamanian marines investigating whether it was carrying contraband.
6.title: Panama Charges North Korean Freighter Crew

7.summary: The body of Stephen Rakes, who said he was an extortion victim of James (Whitey) Bulger, was found in Lincoln, Mass., the authorities said.
7.title: Potential Witness in Bulger Trial Is Found Dead

8.summary: After weeks battling critical illness, Nelson Mandela spent his 95th birthday in the hospital on Thursday, and South Africans across the country celebrated Mandela Day.
8.title: Mandela Said to Be ‘Steadily Improving’ on 95th Birthday

9.summary: The law, championed by Gov. Rick Perry, bans abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy and requires abortion clinics to meet the same standards as hospital-style surgical centers.
9.title: Perry Signs Texas Abortion Restrictions Into Law

10.summary: The Palestinian leadership did not approve Secretary of State John Kerry’s plan for reviving peace talks with Israel, dulling hope for a breakthrough.
10.title: Palestinians Call Kerry’s Formula for Talks Insufficient

11.summary: What you need to know for Thursday: Unusual places to cool off on another very hot day, Nelson Mandela’s 95th birthday and a lost chicken is rescued in Brooklyn.
11.title: City Room: New York Today: Be Cool

12.summary: The military judge in the trial of Pfc. Bradley Manning decided on Thursday not to drop a charge accusing Private Manning of “aiding the enemy.”
12.title: Judge in Manning Case Allows Charge of Aiding the Enemy

13.summary: Texas Gov. Rick Perry signed sweeping new abortion restrictions on Thursday that could shutter most of the clinics in the state.
13.title: Gov. Perry Signs Sweeping Abortion Restrictions

14.summary: Sure, you could spend a weekend pitching and putting in this golfing paradise. But look at all you’d be missing.
14.title: 36 Hours in Hilton Head Island, S.C.

15.summary: Dell adjourned a vote on its proposed $24.4 billion sale to its founder on Thursday morning, signaling that the planned transaction lacked enough support from shareholders.
15.title: DealBook: Dell Adjourns Vote on Deal as Some Big Investors Start to Shift

16.summary: Eight Afghan men heading to work at an American base on Thursday morning were pulled from their car by insurgents and killed, officials said.
16.title: Insurgents Kill 8 Afghans Near U.S. Base

17.summary: Morgan Stanley reported adjusted earnings for the second quarter that slightly beat analysts’ estimates, driven by a strong performance from its wealth management unit and equity sales and trading.
17.title: DealBook: Morgan Stanley Posts 42% Rise in Profit and Sets Stock Buyback

18.summary: JPMorgan Chase wants to settle accusations by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission that it gleaned profits from power plants via “manipulative schemes.”
18.title: DealBook: In Energy Case, a Fresh Tactic by JPMorgan: A Push to Settle

19.summary: The operator of the ravaged nuclear plant in Japan stood ready Thursday to inject boric acid into the reactor if temperature or radiation levels rose.
19.title: Steam Detected at Damaged Fukushima Reactor

20.summary: Sixty-one percent of voters said a candidate’s ability to understand the needs and problems of ordinary New Yorkers was the most important factor in the race.
20.title: Voters Approve of City’s Progress, Poll Finds, but Seek Empathetic Mayor

21.summary: A Russian judge on Thursday found opposition leader Alexei Navalny guilty of theft, a ruling that could send the charismatic anti-corruption blogger and Moscow mayoral candidate to prison for up to six years.
21.title: Russian Opposition Leader Navalny Found Guilty

22.summary: A fast-growing wildfire in the mountains of Southern California forced the evacuation on Wednesday of the popular resort community of Idyllwild after flames engulfed seven homes and numerous other buildings.
22.title: Southern California Wildfire Forces Evacuation of Mountain Resort

23.summary: A Pew survey found that since 2011, China’s approval rating in the United States dropped to 37 percent and negative attitudes toward the United States among the Chinese rose to 53 percent.
23.title: In China and U.S., Mutual Distrust Grows, Study Finds

-1.summary: As frustrated refugees appealed for Western military intervention, Mr. Kerry’s visit soon became a graphic illustration of the limits of Washington policy.
-1.title: Touring Refugee Camp, Kerry Sees Mounting Syrian Suffering
